Reviews.Title: “Great place with excellent owners”
Reviews.Author: chrispyshrimp
Reviews.Content: Made sure our family of 15 was comfortable and felt at home. The boat rental was way more than fair and the new swim dock was a favorite hang out for everyone. I say its the best location for easy access to everything fun in branson. John really made an extra effort to make us comfy for the week. Way to go John!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: lisaandstan
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in cabin A9. Our view of the lake was amazing! We had a family reunion, with 19 family members coming from Texas, Kansas, Colorado and Georgia. We rented 6 of their cabins, and all were well appointed, clean, spacious and had great views of Table rock lake. The owners, John and Teresa were excellent host's. They were very responsive to our needs, personable and downright enjoyable to hang out with. They joined our family (John is an excellent cook), for a couple of dinner cookout's. The resort has available for rent several boats, ski, poonton, fishing and even paddle boats. We rented the ski and poontoon for a couple of days and enjoyed all of the water sports the beautiful lake had to offer. We Water ski'd, tube'd, cruised, cliff dove, took sunset cruise and even boated to the local restaurants for a couple of dinners out. Perfect lake vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best Cabin on Table Rock Lake”
Reviews.Author: mcr_in_wi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in cabin A10 and where amazed by the great view of table Rock lake. This is the Last Resort at the end Jakes Creek Trail. The cabin was very clean and the owners are very friendly. John is an experienced fisherman and gave us great advice on fishing Table Rock Lake. There are boat silps available (with electric outlets), a private launch, a cleaning station, boats available to rent, and plenty of parking for trailers. Everything in Branson is only 20 minutes away. We ate at only the local restaurants (no chains) and found the food fantastic. The cabins are fully stocked and each has its own grill for the days you just want to hang out by the lake. Probably one of the best vacations we ever had. We will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best lake resort on Table rock lake”
Reviews.Author: kuhoops7
Reviews.Content: After jumping for 15 years from resort to resort on table rock we have found the best place to stay. If you want clean and close to branson this is your place.We have stayed at many lake resorts at table rock and other lakes and this one is hands down the best we have been at. From the cabins that have alot of room and clean clean clean even the boat dock is clean. If you want close to town great owners and not having to worry about what you are coming to this is the place. 5 stars great new owners Thanks and yes we are coming back!

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Nancy S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found Artilla Cove via the internet. We were looking for a quiet place for a little R & R and we found it here. Our cabin was perfect and spotlessly clean. The veiw off of our deck, lovely. The new owners, John and Teresa, were great, friendly and available. And while we sought quiet Artilla Cove is just minutes from Silver Dollar City and the main attractions of Branson. We loved it and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Our new default place to stay in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: Christina M
Reviews.Content: Immaculate cabin. Beautiful views. Decent price. Very peaceful. We love it, close to the hustle and bustle of Branson but far enough away to feel like we are getting away! Please do not other reviews scare you off, great place and nice owners who care about their place!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, affordable, and simple”
Reviews.Author: CleverCouple
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at the resort. Its not really a "resort", but more like cottages with kitchenettes. It was quiet, peaceful, and affordable. The beds were a bit on the hard side, but they weren't terrible, they were clean and smelled fresh/laundered. The towels were refreshed daily along with the trash taken out, otherwise we were left to ourselves! Down the road was a few places to eat, a convenience store with sports bar, and zipline! According to thier facebook page, new owners took over in Aug 2011, so we did not experience any neurotic hosts.. the hosts/owners kept to themselves and offered assistance only when asked. The only problem that we had was the traffice to and from Silver Dollar City, so if you are not wanting to go anywhere in Branson, this was a good place!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to visit while in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Bobbie M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Artilla Cove Resort for 3 days during Aug. 2011. The resort has new owners and we found them to be very pleasant, helpful, and eager to accomodate any request. Our cabin was immaculate and well furnished. Beautiful views of Table Rock Lake, and very peaceful. It is about a 12 minute drive to "town." We plan on returning there again and highly recommend Artilla Cove.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but owner seemed "put out"”
Reviews.Author: poodledoodle56
Reviews.Content: A nice, cozy place to stay however, the owners seem put out by your requests to obtain show tickets. This is a service that the establishments provides and had I known that we were to miss a show that we had our hearts set on because the owner didn't follow through with getting the tickets, I would have gotten them myself. I think the couple that owns Artilla are getting burnt out and maybe should consider selling.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on quiet cove”
Reviews.Author: Beaverlake
Reviews.Content: We found this resort to be very clean, well maintained, with a great view of Table Rock lake. We brought a boat with us and the launch area was level, as was the road leading into the area (some of them are very curvy and steep). We rented an A-frame, there was a amall kitchenette with utensils provided, cooktop stove and microwave, as well as a charcoal grill outside by the picnic table. The owners request that you seperate cans and plastic, which we didn't have a problem with, and they also provide daily trash pickup. Upon checkin, we were given a lengthy list of "rules" but found that they were mostly common sense suggestions that I personally would expect as a resort owner, and also a list of their favorite eating places which I thought was very helpful. We would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Great Place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveler2009
Reviews.Content: Not sure what the other reviewers are talking about. I found the couple running Artilla Cove to be overly helpful and incredibly nice. The place was immaculate and I appreciated the daily towel and trash service. The view of the lake was wonderful to wake up to every morning. Boat rental was easy and we had a great time on the lake. Unlike others who had a issue with the signs around the cabin, I found them to be par for the course like in many other hotels. The owners obviously take great care of there property and want to make sure it stays that way. Since it was not my intent to damage anything, reminders didn't phase me at all. Highly recommend this place to anyone visiting the Branson area. A great place to spend your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Neurotic Obsessive-Compulsive Owners”
Reviews.Author: itstruth
Reviews.Content: We are currently looking for a place for our '09 trip and I was considering this because I always appreciate cleanliness. However, I am glad I read the reviews, because I then remembered staying here a few years back, and I would not go back. The owners (I think it is primarily the lady) are neurotic obsessive-compulsive types. All the reviews are correct. She came in our cabin EVERY TIME we left, and 'cleaned' up. This wasn't just to replace the towels either. It was really unsettling to have all our things moved around. She closed up the sleeper sofa every day. Our kids were at the age that we would come back in the afternoon and lay down in the afternoon before our evening fun. It was just a hassle to open it all back up again. I pay for peace and privacy when I am on vacation and here you will get neither. It is not a welcoming atmosphere at all. These people should go into a home cleaning, appliance monitoring and repair business.

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed The Cove!!”
Reviews.Author: LadyCaptain
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days at Artilla Cove. The owners were very pleasant people. We originally rented a pontoon boat from the Cove. We were told upon arrival that the boat was out of commission. The owners were kind enough to make sure we had a replacement rental. We rented an A frame. It was amazingly clean! Most of us seasoned travelers so appreciate that! Alot of folks seemed offended by the notes pasted all over the cabins. I was not offended, as it was things I would have done normally anyway. (Wash dishes, sort trash etc.) We had a beautiful view of the lake, and with an early morning walk down the hill we could start our day with a cup of coffee and fishing! The grounds were immaculent. Quiet, Quaint, and Casual is the three words I would use to describe Artilla Cove. The price was wonderful for the location. Right on beautiful Tablerock Lake, and within a mile or so from Silver Dollar City. This is a great place for families. No loud partying. My only complaint about our stay was the bed. Altho big and made up with nice soft cotton linens..it killed my back! (course some of that may have been the wild wave runner ride my hubby and I took)! I would certainly reccomend Artilla Cove for fisherman, and family get togethers, or even that quiet weekend away. Nice owners, exceptionally clean, peaceful, beautiful view, right on the water,boat dock, well lit...grills for each cabin..good fishin..who could ask for more??

Reviews.Title: “Loved Artilla Cove”
Reviews.Author: shanli7
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Artilla Cove Resort and had a great experience. The cabin was really clean and well taken care of and the grounds were immaculate. The owners were very nice to us and we were treated pleasantly through the entire stay. I was not offended by them asking us to put the towels in the shower and to keep recyclables separate. I think they take great pride in their place and want to keep things running smoothly. As a matter of fact, they were very good about coming in while we were out and keeping the towels well-stocked. We travelled with 2 kids and they enjoyed the swimming pool and were happy that there were pool toys for them to play with. They also enjoyed the slide at the pool. We rented one of their pontoon boats while we were there and they were very nice about that and the boat was in good shape. As far as I'm concerned, you can't get a better deal for the money and we enjoyed the fact that it was close to town, yet quiet and secluded. I would highly recommend Artilla Cove and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain rude!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I haven't officially stayed at Artilla Cove, but have recently decided I won't want to! I had called to see if they had any A-frames available for a Thurs. - Sun. time period, because that's the only time we can go & she got really annoyed by me asking if that would be ok. She had said, "why would I want to rent a cabin to you at the end of the week? Then it cuts up the whole entire week!" So I had made a statment saying, "so you only rent by the week then?" And she just repeated herself over & over asking me why she would rent like that. She said she had a B Cabin available that we could stay in & I told her, "I don't know what those look like. Why would I want to stay in a cabin when I don't even know what it looks like?" Then she proceeded to say that they're REALLY nice, & whenever I come down there, to come by & she'll show me what a B Cabin looks like. So then I had said, "no thanks, if you don't have any A-frames available, then I just won't worry about it." And she said something to me that just kind of rubbed me the wrong way when she said, real snooty like, "so you'd rather stay some place that isn't as nice because you can't get an A-frame here?" And I told her, "Yes. I wanted an A-frame, what's so wrong with that?" And right in the middle of me saying this she says OK BYE! & hung up on me. If that's the way they treat their potential customers when they don't get their way, it's a wounder that they have any business at all?

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everytime we go to Branson we stay Artilla Cove. This place can't be beat on Indian Point. This is the cleanest place I have ever been. The owners take great pride in their cabins. Other reviewers have stated they felt that they felt big brother is watching them. However, we have never had this experience. The hosts were nothing but helpful and friendly. Artilla Cove is a family run resort and is family friendly. I completely understand that the owners would want some rules in order to keep the cabins in good shape for the next people coming in. I appreciate the time, effort and care they take with their cabins so that they are pleasant for me to stay in while keeping the costs down. The few things that they ask you to do (put your towels in the shower when done, frankly I find their towel service a plus not a hindrance) is nothing less than what I would do at home. Just because I am on vacation doesn't mean I should treat the cabin as a dump making it unpleasant to stay in. Having worked in small businesses I completely understand the owners requests to help keep their resort as nice as they can so they don't have to raise prices. This place can't be beat for the great views,friendly atmosphere, well taken care of clean cabins and reasonable price. I highly reccomend Artilla Cove.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, two different experiences”
Reviews.Author: arkansastraveler42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 different times and had 2 different experiences. In 2000, my husband and I stayed in one of the A-frames and it was very clean and comfortable. There were no signs regarding stealing or listing the values of items on this trip. In 2003, we stayed in one of the larger cabins. This time we definitely noticed a difference. Besides signs and reminders posted everywhere in the cabin about stealing stuff, there were instructions about everything. Towels had to be put in the bathtub and sheets had to be removed from sofa beds every day! We asked if we could just wait until the end of the stay and they said no! Something about the sheets getting torn if we remade the sofa bed. Anyway, when we are on vacation, I don't want to have to stress over every detail, I want to relax and have a good time and not worry about it. We will be trying a new place this year.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place, Strange People”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No frills, reasonable rates, very clean. However, the reminders regarding the possessions in the rooms was, as others stated, very disturbing, we thought. We won't return because so many other hotels, resorts, etc exist.. that do not remind occupants of room items. We felt like "occupants" vs "guests," if you know what we mean. Also, we reserved the room for 2 nights with a credit card, but the owner insisted we bring cash to pay for the room.. very strange (tax purposes?). Same deal with show tickets as well; a lady there stated we "shouldn't" use a credit card because they had to pay some sort of fee. Can you say CHEAP??? We can.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 09/01 for 4 nights. Good location-convenient to Silver Dollar City and Branson yet that out in the country, on the lake feel. I do agree with one of your other reviews that the owners seemed unnaturally concerned for the itemized and price-listed items in the rooms. Our vast travels over the past 28 years and this is the ONLY place that did this. Also offered with the accomodations is advance purchase of tickets to the theaters and Silver Dollar City. Most of the hotels in the area offer this service. As the owner was making her calls to order our tickets she complained to us that she would be charged a handling fee for us paying her with a credit card and not cash. When we stayed in Branson the following year, we stayed at a "brand-name" hotel, ordered our tickets and the clerk was extremely pleasant and helpful and didn't give us an itemization of the items in our hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place is clean, but.. it was very strange.. when we checked in, and right in front of this occurred.. one owner went out and got our license plate numbers. The guy came back in, stating, "Got 'em!!" The lady asked, "Did you get the 2nd car??" "Yep," the guy said. So, if this does not feel welcoming, I don't know what does.. could they maybe have spit on our faces as well??? Very tacky.. very tacky. Anyway, what more can you also say about a place that prints the value of the room's TV remote control.. and then a printout that goes on about the "valuables" within the room, etc, etc, etc.. We assumed they've had problems with various other guests stealing items, among them the remote control--and boy, this just makes you feel wonderful staying in a place like this.. with your cars parked right outside. Is it OUR fault they've had theft problems, however? We just did not feel right staying there, our license plates recorded, along with the reminders of the in-cabin valuables, and something to the effect of "we're watching you.... we're watching you.. you'd better not steal anything.. we're watching you [eerie music].. we're watching you......" It was a very disturbing experience. We won't return, that is for CERTAIN. It was quite.. creepy. It's all about etiquette and manners.. If you're fiendish enough to want people's plate#s: a) get a credit card imprint beforehand b) get the plate numbers quietly, like most places do c) don't put a monetary value on the price of your remote control, for crying out loud. You can go to Walmart and get a Universal Remote for like $6. You're warned.. hell, why not install video surveillance in the showers, bedrooms, etc..

HotelInfo.Name: Artilla Cove
HotelInfo.Address: 1123 Jakes Creek Trail, Branson, MO 65616
